results.title: The Hague - Holland
results.creator_credit: Hans Vos, Carrilon Films, Holland and Caspar Willers
results.brief_description: The capital of the Netherlands is a felicitous mixture of the old and the new. The film explores the city and the cultural and international events that take place there.

results.title: The Hacktivists [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Hilton Cordell, Dominant 7, Chris Hilton, Peter Day, Laurnet Bocahut and Ian Walker
results.brief_description: This documentary - an Australian/French co-production - examines Internet based civil action and protests, and the individuals who invent and co-ordinate such exploits. Known as hacktivists, the intention of these protestors is to disrupt business, such as e-commerce and prevent websites from operating effectively. The hacktivists (who range across the globe) are principally concerned with globalisation and capitalism. Their perception is that they are modern dissidents whose activities sit alongside, even boost and support, traditional forms of street protest. In this documentary, several hacktivists are interviewed, discussing their aims, politics and methodology, which may include bombarding companies with emails or performing cyber sit-ins, immobilising a website. These activities are not only effective but also pose a danger to big corporations with net-based trade. There are also interviews with the Canadian police and a cyber expert employed by companies to anticipate and undermine hacktivist activities. One mission of online activism is to explain the philosophy to ordinary people and encourage them to take part. Electro-hippies (as they are known) believe that electronic forms of protest will become even more effective as their methods improve and e-commerce expands. The war looks set to continue.

results.title: The Gypsy moth
results.brief_description: The uncontrolled spread of the gypsy moth is creating a serious problem that is difficult to estimate economically. In this film the audience sees the type and extent of the damage caused by these prolific insects, as well as the ease with which they are transported from one area to another by unsuspecting humans. The moth was introduced to North America from Europe in 7869 by a scientist, and has now spread with insufficient naturel predators, thereby causing great damage to Canada’s forests and crops. Superb photography.

results.title: The Gunston tapes
results.brief_description: Contains the best of the Norman Gunston shows. The video includes Warren Beatty and the Qantas air hostess, Hugh Heffner, Muhammad Ali, Keith Moon assaulting “The Little Aussie Bleeder” with a vodka bottle, and the Spaceship Southern Hemisphere.

results.title: The Guitar
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Muir Mathieson and Anvil Film and Recording Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
This film briefly outlines the history of the guitar through a period of six thousand years. Guitarist John Williams examines the construction of the instrument; describes the nature and tuning of the strings, placing of the frets, and demonstrates all the varieties of sound possible using music by Bach, Paganini, Weber and Schubert. Includes sequences on the lute, electric guitar and Spanish classical guitar.

results.title: The Guide to 35mm photography
results.brief_description: Brian Ratty introduces this instructional video on how to use a 35mm camera. The program is divided into three half-hour chapters. Part one covers: How the SLR works, “f” stops and shutter speeds, exposure, depth of field and film. Part two covers: Lenses, available light, flash, filters and steady shooting. Part three covers: seeing with the camera, candids, portraits, the environmental portrait and sports and action.

results.title: The Guide log
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: The story of the Girl Guides Association from the enrolment of a Brownie to the work of the Trefoil Guild or Senior Branch. Explains the work and play of the movement: social work, camping, cooking, keeping house, sailing, gliding, etc. Sequences include national dances performed by participation in an international guide camp.

results.title: The Grudge 2 = Ju-on 2
results.creator_credit: Takashige Ichise, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing Company, Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha and Takashi Shimizu
results.brief_description: In this sequel to “The Grudge”, a Tokyo house has been the site of many strange disappearances. A television crew go to investigate the site, setting off a spate of killings by the evil spirit that dwells there. Although not as well received as “The Grudge” this horror film contains a convoluted narrative, but contains exemplary scares and thrills, fitting for the genre, with a chilling finale. Cast includes: Noriko Sakai, Chiharu Niiyama and Kei Horie.
